definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In general, the information from the blog posts is informative.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，博客内的内容是具教育性的。

sentences.english: with educational games and regular downloadable updates with new activities.
sentences.chinese: 带有教育性的游戏和可下载的更新。

sentences.english: They have opportunities at each house to participate in organized educational as well as social events.
sentences.chinese: 他们有机会在各学舍参加教育性及社交性的团体活动。

sentences.english: The chief apostolate of the order is educational.
sentences.chinese: 行政使徒的命令是教育性。

sentences.english: Yellow journalism is hardly educational And informative, but a lot of people love it.
sentences.chinese: 八卦新闻没什么教育性和知识性，可是许多人爱看。

sentences.english: Emotion is its 'bond, touching students' hearts, permeating educational nature.
sentences.chinese: 以感情为纽带，打动学生的心灵，渗透教育性。

definition: to make learning fun/to combine education and entertainment
to grow the intellect/Alpinia oxyphylla, a type of ginger (Chinese medicine)
